name: Name
element-no-references-hint: The current element is not reused at other locations.
element-multiple-references-hint: The current element is used at the following locations. If you edit it, it will be edited there as well.
formal-expression-error: Your entered formal expression contains an error. Please revise your input.
mobile-metadata-hint: You are currently using a small device to design the forms. While this is fine and doable, we suggest switching to a device with a larger screen to benefit from a simplified editing workflow.
condition-multiple-references-hint: This condition is used for other elements as well. Do you want to update it for all elements?
measurement-unit-multiple-references-hin: This measurement unit is used for other items as well. Do you want to update it for all items?
metadata-reload-question: The forms have just been updated by another user. We recommend that you reload the form definitions. Do you want to do this now?
no-subjects-hint: No subjects available. Please add a new subject with the button above.
no-subject-selected-hint: No subject selected. You can still view and test the form but entered data will not be stored. You can select a subject by clicking on it in the left column.
no-subject-selected-warning: No subject selected. Please select a subject in the left column first.
audit-record-data-hint: You are currently viewing data from the audit trail.
form-validated-hint: This form was marked as validated. It cannot be edited until it has been marked as unvalidated again.
survey-finished-text: Thank you for taking the survey.
survey-finished-code-text: Please enter the survey code to close this window.
wrong-survey-code-hint: Wrong code entered. Please try again.
date-warning: Please enter a date (format: yyyy-mm-dd) or use the date picker.
time-warning: Please enter a time (format: hh:mm) or use the time picker.
datetime-warning: Please enter a datetime (format: yyyy-mm-dd[T]hh:mm) or use the datetime picker.
unanswered-mandatory-questions-warning: Please try to answer all highlighted mandatory questions. If you cannot answer one of these questions, you can let it empty.
close-form-text: It seems that you just edited or entered new data. Do you really want to close the current form?
close-survey-text: Do you really want to end the survey?
choices-multiple-references-hint: Editing the choices affects the following elements:
same-item-referenced-error: You referenced the same item that you are currently editing.
codelist-not-found-error: There could be no choices found for this item.
no-codelist-hint: The data type of the current item is not Choices. If you want to add predefined choices, first set the according data type at the top.
subject: Subject
data-loading-hint: Please wait until the data is loaded.
example-data-loaded-hint: Some sample data and reports have been loaded.
connected-hint: You are connected to an OpenEDC Server.
connection-hint: With this option you can connect to an OpenEDC Server. This lets you create projects with multiple users. All currently existing data is synced to the server. Current and future data will be end-to-end encrypted by default.
new-account-hint: You can now create an account for the server. Please choose a secure password that you can remember.
encryption-hint: With this option you can fully encrypt all locally stored data. All currently stored and future data will then be encrypted. When you open the app again, you need to enter the password to decrypt the data.
encryption-warning: Warning: If you forget the password, all data will be permanently lost.
subject-key-hint: You can choose between three modes of adding new subjects. You can either enter a subject manually, let the system generate an incrementing number, or scan a barcode using your device's camera.
subject-key-mode-barcode: Use the device's camera to scan a barcode
survey-code-hint: This option lets you set a four-digit numerical code that needs to be entered after a local survey (started with the Survey View button) is finished or canceled. This prevents study participants from seeing foreign data.
miscellaneous-options-hint: In the following, different miscellaneous options are listed that you can activate by clicking on it. If you are connected to a server, the options are valid for all users.
element-name-hint: Allow editing the name of elements, according to the CDISC ODM standard. If disabled, the name is automatically set to the value of the ID.
show-as-likert-hint: Show itemgroups as likert scale if possible. Itemgroups with an alias tag 'no-likert' and the value 'yes' are ignored.
no-likert-description: If you check this checkbox, the itemgroup is not shown in likert form even with the project options set to likert scale.
textarea-hint: Render items with the datatype String as multi-line textareas instead of one-line inputs.
survey-view-hint: Automatically open the survey view on mobile devices when clicking on a study event.
export-data-hint: These options let you download the project in CDISC ODM-XML or CSV format. You can either download all data (including the metadata and data from all subjects including the entire audit trail), or only the metadata or clinicaldata. Please note that only the first option creates a backup of your project.
import-data-hint: With this option you can import metadata from a CDISC ODM-XML file. Events and forms will then be added. If you want to import an entire project with clinical data, first remove all current data with the option below.
example-data-hint: This option allows you to generate example subjects for your forms. Please be aware that these subjects are not suited for being used in a clinical study.
incorrect-amount: Please chose a number greater than 0.
remove-data-hint: The following option lets you remove all stored data and thereby reset the current project.
users-hint: The following panel lets you add users to the current project. Please note that you can only add new users when you are connected to an OpenEDC Server.
no-users-hint: No users available. Please add a new user with the button below.
sites-hint: With the following panel you can add and edit sites. Subjects can be assigned to sites to conduct multi-centric research projects.
no-sites-hint: No sites available. Please add a new site with the button below.
name-and-description-hint: The following panel lets you edit the study name, study description, and protocol name. The study name will be displayed in the top navigation bar of this app.
about-text-1: This open-source electronic data capture (EDC) system lets you design and conduct secure medical research studies based on the CDISC ODM-XML standard.
about-text-2: All data is processed and stored only on your local device. You can optionally connect to your own OpenEDC Server to create research studies with multiple users and sites.
start-text: For an empty project, choose New Project. Click Open if you have a CDISC ODM-XML file on your computer. If you have not yet used this EDC system, choose Example to load an illustrative project and see how it all works.
load-from-mdm-text: Please enter an ID to an ODM form of the MDM-Portal. You can find the ID in the browser address bar when opening the form in the MDM-Portal.
load-from-mdm-exceeded: You reached the maximum of available download from the MDM-Portal for this hour. Please chose another method.
load-from-mdm-error: The MDM-Portal is currently unavailable. Please try again later or chose another method.
remove-subject-hint: Are you sure, you want to delete this subject?
element-remove-hint: The reference to the element will be removed. The element definition will be removed as well if there is no other reference to it.
reference-added-hint: Please now move the new reference into another parent element using drag-and-drop. The same reference may only appear once in a parent element.
enter-subject-key-text: Please enter a key for the subject first.
subject-key-existent-text: The entered subject key already exists. Please enter another one.
subject-key-existent-open-text: This subject already exists. Do you want to open the associated data?
subject-key-existent-other-site-text: This subject already exists at another site. Please enter another key.
id-not-changed-error-used: The entered unique ID is already in use.
id-not-changed-error-data: The unique ID could not be changed since there is clinical data assigned to this element. You can try to remove the element to see a list of subjects that contain data for this element.
coded-value-not-changed-error-used: The entered coded value is already in use.
coded-value-not-changed-error-data: The coded value could not be changed since there is clinical data assigned to this element. You can try to remove the element to see a list of subjects that contain data for this element.
element-not-moved-error: The element could not be moved since there is clinical data assigned to it. You can try to remove the element to see a list of subjects that contain data for this element.
cannot-be-removed-text: You cannot currently remove this element since it has clinical data assigned for the following subjects:
subject-not-loaded-error:
The selected subject could not be loaded. Your are either offline and open the subject for the first time or someone just recently edited the subject.

Please wait a few seconds and try again.
subject-edited-error: Your currently opened subject has been edited by another user. We suggest that you reload the subject to prevent data conflicts. If you have made substantial changes, you can also save your changes and resolve the conflict later on.
data-conflicts-present-error:
One subject exists multiple times in your data. This can happen when multiple users edited the same subject at the same time or if a user worked offline over an extended period of time.

The affected subjects are marked with a red dot. Please review the data and remove the subject instance(s) that you do not want to keep. You can look in the audit trail to see which person audited which instance.
server-initialized-hint: The server has already been initialized. Do you want to navigate to the server?
server-not-found-error: There could be no OpenEDC Server found for this URL.
passwords-not-equal: The password and confirmation password are not equal.
password-not-secure: The password must be at least eight characters in length and have a number, lower case and upper case character.
survey-code-error: The survey code could not be set. Enter a 4-digit numerical code.
remove-data-complete-warning: Do you really want to remove all data? This cannot be undone.
remove-data-clinicaldata-warning: Do you really want to remove all clinical data? This cannot be undone.
user-not-removed-hint: The user could not be removed. It seems that you are connected to an OpenEDC Server but the user could not be removed from the server. Please check your Internet connection and try again.
site-not-removed-hint-subject: The site could not be removed since there is at least one subject assigned to it.
site-not-removed-hint-user: The site could not be removed since there is at least one user assigned to it.
please-login-text: You are connected to an OpenEDC Server. Please login with your credentials.
first-login-text: This is your first login. Please choose a new secure password.
login-encrypted-text: Please enter the password that you used for the data encryption.
password-incorrect-error: The password is incorrect. Please try again.
username-password-incorrect-error: The username or password is incorrect. Please try again.
app-outdated-hint: You are using an outdated version of OpenEDC. To upgrade to the latest version, please close the app or the browser tab and then reopen OpenEDC.
app-offline-hint: You are currently using the application offline. While is fine, please still try to open the application soon with an Internet connection so that data stored offline can be synchronized.
barcode-help-text: If your device does not provide a camera or the barcode scan does not work, you can manually enter the barcode value below.
server-uninitialized-hint:
This OpenEDC Server has not yet been initialized.

You can either go to openedc.org to initialize this server with data that you have already locally captured there, or, alternatively, close this hint, start a new local project here, and initialize the server from here as well.

In both cases, use the Project Options button in the top left corner of the app and follow the instructions to initialize this server.
forgot-password-server-hint:
All data within OpenEDC is stored and transferred end-to-end encrypted. Therefore, it is currently not possible to automatically reset a forgotten password, unfortunately.

If you forgot your password, please contact the person that gave you your login credentials. This person is able to reset your password with a new initial password.
forgot-password-encrypted-hint:
You encrypted all data within OpenEDC. Therefore, the stored data cannot be viewed or edited without your password.

If you forgot your password, you have to remove all data to use OpenEDC again, unfortunately.
logout-question: Do you want to log out?
metadata-edit-mode-question: It seems that your OpenEDC Server is actively used. In order to edit forms at this point, you must switch into a special editing mode. Activating this mode can take some time depending on the number of subjects. We will let you know, if the editing mode was enabled. Alternatively, you can go into a view-only mode, where you can view but not edit forms.
edit-mode-enabled-hint: The editing mode has been successfully enabled. Please remember to click on Save Forms after you made all changes.
save-forms-question: Do you want to save all changes that you made to the forms?
metadata-not-found-error: One or multiple items in the clinical data could not be found in the metadata. This means that your clinical data and metadata might be out of sync or an imported ODM file is (partially) broken. You can find a list of all clinical data items that could not be found in the metadata below.
hidden-field-with-value-error: Based on the conditions, one or multiple items in the clinical data should be hidden but have values assigned to them. These fields were highlighted and can be reviewed and emptied by you.
import-forms-merge-hint: You already have forms in your project. Do you want to append the new forms to your project, remove your current data before import, or not load the new forms?
forms-import-encrypted-hint: Unfortunately, it is currently not possible to add forms from external repositories when working with encrypted data.
forms-import-error: Could not load forms from external repository.
upload-note-redcap: You uploaded a REDCap ODM file. Please note that REDCap currently does not fully adhere to the CDISC ODM-XML standard. There might be some hickups in using this file.
new-project-hint:
You created your new project

Start by adding your first event with a click on the Add button below the Events title.

Events refer to points in time or incidents during your study for which you want to collect data. This could be, for example, Baseline and Follow-up or Patient-reported data and Routine data. It is fine if your study consists of only one event.
first-event-hint:
You added your first event

You can now add a description to your event. Please note that this description is dependent on the language that you have currently selected.

You can change the language at any time to add new translations to your project which lets you create a multilingual study.
first-event-edited-hint:
You added your first description

You can now continue by adding a form to the event. Then you can add a group to the form and then items to that group. When you have created your first few items, you can click on Capture Data to see the form in action.

Go to Project Options to see more options for your project.

Great luck with your study!
exemplary-project-hint:
Exemplary project opened

You can now start by creating a new test patient in the Subjects column. If you click on an Event, you will see the associated Forms to the right. Clicking on a form allows you to enter Data for the currently selected subject.

You can customize the structure of the forms by clicking on the Design Forms button in the upper right corner. If you want to close the example, click on Close Example.
edit-settings-text: In this view you can assing setting values to single elements.
no-survey-description: If you check this checkbox, the element will not be shown in the survey view.
export-not-allowed: You are not allowed to export data.
